sentence.text: George had a wife , Martha , who was dumpy and plain .
The other was a small , dumpy woman , the sort you 'd cheerfully accept an apple pie from .
Miss Grey was short and dumpy and all she could manage to do was warble a little out of tune .
He was short , dumpy and big-nosed , his hair was nondescript sandy and thinning ; no suit could stand the strain of his hyperactive volatility for more than a few hours .
Kitty , her heroine , is dumpy , spotty , pallid and downtrodden .
She was a small , dumpy woman , nothing like her only child in either looks or personality .
She was an extraordinary human being , and it was a damn shame that her personality and talents should have been encased in that little dumpy body of hers .
Very few people knew that yet I was there when they opened poor Catherine 's dumpy body and took out her heart .

The dumpy girl had finished playing tennis .
The little dumpy girl was one of two serving .
A small dumpy woman pushed forward .
The dumpy woman went bustling into a large stone flagged kitchen where a great fire flamed in an open fireplace and the smell of roasting meat rose from a thick flank of beef on a spit .
Barbara Lipscombe , a cheerful , warm , slightly dumpy woman , lives in a rented three house and has three children under five .
A short , dumpy lady shaped rather like a cottage loaf , she seldom smiled and woe betide anyone not paying attention .
